testsuite.name: Checkout End-to-End Flow
testsuite.system-out: @web @checkout @endtoend Scenario: End-to-end checkout # src/test/resources/features/web/checkout.feature:5 Given User is logged in with valid credentials # web.steps.LoginSteps.user_logged_in() And User adds "Sauce Labs Bolt T-Shirt" to the cart # web.steps.CartSteps.user_adds_item(java.lang.String) When User navigates to the cart page # web.steps.CartSteps.user_navigates_to_cart() And User clicks the checkout button # web.steps.CheckoutSteps.user_clicks_checkout() And User enters first name "John", last name "Doe", and postal code "12345" # web.steps.CheckoutSteps.user_enters_checkout_info(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.lang.String) And User clicks the continue button # web.steps.CheckoutSteps.user_clicks_continue() And User clicks the finish button # web.steps.CheckoutSteps.user_clicks_finish() Then User should see the confirmation message "Thank you for your order!" # web.steps.CheckoutSteps.user_sees_confirmation(java.lang.String)

You may need to include a dependency on a specific version of the CDP using something similar to `org.seleniumhq.selenium:selenium-devtools-v86:4.11.0` where the version ("v86") matches the version of the chromium-based browser you're using and the version number of the artifact is the same as Selenium's.
